title: In a purely utilitarian point of view, feeding is a positive thing
body:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utilitarianism

>The best action is the one that procures the greatest happiness for the greatest numbersâ€”and the worst is the one that causes the most misery.

In a game of League of Legends, when one player on a team feeds, he makes the other 4 players on his team unhappy, while making the 5 players on the enemy team happy. The feeding player may or may not be enjoying himself, but if he is - that is a sum of 6 players having a positive experience while 4 have a negative experience.

Why is this a bad thing?
